name: turf
description: Multi-agent coordination for AI coding agents. Prevents file conflicts through scope leasing, workspace isolation, and ordered merge queues.

capabilities.name: scope-leasing
capabilities.description: Claim exclusive file ownership via glob patterns with TTL. No two agents can edit the same files simultaneously.

capabilities.name: workspace-isolation
capabilities.description: Allocate isolated git worktrees per agent. Each agent gets its own working directory with shared coordination state.
capabilities.command: turf workspace allocate --name agent-1 --branch feat/task --base main

capabilities.name: merge-queue
capabilities.description: Submit completed work to an ordered integration queue. A daemon process merges items sequentially, preventing conflicts.

capabilities.name: task-management
capabilities.description: Create, assign, and track tasks with scope globs. Workers claim tasks which automatically acquire scope leases.

capabilities.name: audit-trail
capabilities.description: Append-only event log of every coordination action. Query with turf status --verbose.

workflow.summary: 1. Init → 2. Agent claims scope → 3. Agent works in worktree → 4. Agent submits to queue → 5. Daemon merges
